intro: Impatiens lohitensis, commonly known as the Lohit Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Eastern Himalayas. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant is herbaceous, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
